skill.name: labarchive-integration
skill.description: Electronic lab notebook API integration. Access notebooks, manage entries/attachments, backup notebooks, integrate with Protocols.io/Jupyter/REDCap, for programmatic ELN workflows.
skill.summary: Electronic lab notebook API integration. Access notebooks, manage entries/attachments, backup notebo...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: The static analysis flagged numerous false positives. The 'external_commands' findings are markdown code blocks showing API URL patterns, not actual command execution. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' findings reference MD5 in documentation examples, not actual implementation. This is a legitimate research tool for LabArchives API integration with no malicious intent detected.

content.value_statement: Researchers waste hours manually managing lab notebooks and data. This skill automates LabArchives ELN operations including backups, entry creation, and third-party integrations.
actual_capabilities: Authenticate with LabArchives API using institutional credentials
Backup complete notebooks with attachments programmatically
Create entries and upload file attachments to notebooks
Generate site reports and usage analytics
Integrate with Protocols.io, Jupyter, REDCap platforms
limitations: Requires enterprise LabArchives license with API access
API credentials must be obtained from administrator
Regional endpoint must match institutional location

use_cases.title: Automate Daily Notebook Backups
use_cases.description: Schedule automatic backups of all lab notebooks with attachments for data security compliance.

use_cases.title: Bulk Import Experimental Data
use_cases.description: Upload hundreds of experimental files to appropriate notebook entries with metadata tags.

use_cases.title: Generate Compliance Reports
use_cases.description: Create institutional usage reports for audit compliance and license optimization.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Authentication Setup
prompt_templates.scenario: First time setting up LabArchives API access
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me configure LabArchives API access. I need to create a config file with my institutional credentials and test the connection.

prompt_templates.title: Notebook Backup Automation
prompt_templates.scenario: Backing up all notebooks for a research group
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a script to backup all notebooks for user ID 12345 including attachments, organized by date with 7z compression.

prompt_templates.title: Batch Data Upload
prompt_templates.prompt: Upload all CSV files from /data/experiments/ to notebook ID nb_789 under a new entry titled 'Q4 2024 Results' with description containing timestamp.

prompt_templates.title: Integration Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Export my Jupyter notebook analysis to HTML and upload it to LabArchives notebook ID nb_456 with tags 'jupyter', 'analysis', '2024'.

output_examples.input: Backup notebook ID nb_123 for user UID_456 including all attachments
output: âœ“ Connected to LabArchives API (US region)
âœ“ Backup completed: 247 MB saved to ./backups/

best_practices: Store API credentials in environment variables, never in code files
Implement rate limiting between API calls to avoid throttling
Verify backup integrity using checksums after download completion
anti_patterns: Hardcoding credentials directly in scripts or configuration files
Making concurrent API calls without delays causing rate limit errors
Uploading sensitive data without proper encryption or access controls

faq.question: What credentials do I need for API access?
faq.answer: You need institutional API credentials (access_key_id, access_password) from your LabArchives administrator and user external application password from your account settings.

faq.question: Which regional endpoint should I use?
faq.answer: Use the endpoint matching your LabArchives URL: US (mynotebook.labarchives.com), Australia (aunotebook.labarchives.com), or UK (uknotebook.labarchives.com).

faq.question: Can I backup notebooks without attachments?
faq.answer: Yes, use the --no-attachments flag with notebook_operations.py backup command to create JSON exports without file attachments.

faq.question: What file types are supported for upload?
faq.answer: LabArchives supports documents (PDF, DOCX), images (PNG, JPG), data files (CSV, XLSX), scientific formats (CIF, MOL, PDB), and archives (ZIP, 7Z).

faq.question: How do I find my user ID (UID)?
faq.answer: Run setup_config.py which will authenticate and display your UID, or use the authentication test script provided in the documentation.

faq.question: Is OAuth authentication supported?
faq.answer: OAuth 2.0 is available for new third-party integrations. Legacy API key authentication continues to work for direct API access.
